lexUnit.name: pucker.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: tightly gather or contract into wrinkles or small folds.

sentence.text: Sheila puckered her brow with concentration , then looked up with a grin .
She puckered her lips for a moment .
But she suddenly puckered her forehead .
Florrie nodded and puckered her lips .
She raised an enquiring eyebrow , and puckered her lips .
Ellie puckered her brow and stood a little back from the canvas .
She puckered her shaped eyebrows .
Tait puckered his lips and nodded slowly in a gesture of admiration .
His Royal Highness raised an eyebrow and puckered one side of his mouth in a very characteristic grimace of amusement .
Nathaniel Sherman peered at his watch , his face puckering in concentration as he calculated the time necessary to allow the buffalo to move into the most favourable range .
Her brows puckered in a frown , she gazed at the deserted coach , and she did n't realise that Roman had left her until he returned , a furious expression on his face .
Annie 's lips puckered in irritation .
Lost for words , he looked shyly down at her , smiling sadly so that his dark eyebrows puckered into a frown .
Ludovico 's face puckered with anxiety .
Her face puckered with concern .
He saw the girl 's smooth face like a polished fruit pucker with pain .
She tried sitting with her thighs apart in an effort to provide more of a lap , but was not surprised when Harry 's face began to pucker and he started to cry .
The child 's face puckered .
Then seeing Joe 's lips pucker , he walked over to the fireplace and embraced him .
The Grand Duchess 's brow puckered , in slight surprise , as if forgetting for the moment where they were kept .
Ashley 's brow puckered .
